A Guide to the University of Virginia School of Medicine Student Notebook Collection, 1836-1943

archdesc.runner: Historical Collections, Claude Moore Health Sciences Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Historical Collections, Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, University of Virginia
did.unittitle: University of Virginia School of Medicine Student Notebook Collection

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: University of Virginia School of Medicine Student Notebook Collection, Accession #MS-37, Historical Collections, Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The notebooks were donated by various people including Dr. Malcolm Foote Sher, Dr. Porter B. Echols, Jr., the Dr. Armistead P. Booker family, Dr. Weaver, Ms. Roberta Senechal, Jethro Meriwether Hurt, III, and Mr. James Skalnik. At least one of the notebooks was purchased.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The student notebooks contain the notes that medical students took in their classes or laboratories at the University of Virginia. Some of the notebooks belonged to men who would become faculty members at UVa. Those include Armistead Page Booker who was Clinical Instructor in Pediatrics in 1947 and retired from his position of Associate Professor in 1985; William Beverly Towles who became an instructor in anatomy in the 1872-73 session and became Professor of Anatomy and Materia Medica, serving in that position until his death in 1893; Charles Bruce Morton who is listed as the Professor of Clinical Surgery and Gynecology in the "University of Virginia Record" for 1944-45 and was last listed in the "University of Virginia School of Medicine Record" for 1969-70; and Oscar Swineford was listed as an instructor in Medicine in the "University of Virginia Record" of March 15, 1928 and was last listed as a Professor of Internal Medicine in the 1966-67 "University of Virginia Record."

Many of the students included the names of their professors and instructors and those include John Staige Davis, James L. Cabell, John P. Emmet, Henry Howard, Socrates Maupin, Albert H. Tuttle, Stephen Hurt Watts, John Henry Neff, William Hall Goodwin, Lawrence T. Royster, Allen F. Voshell, E. Wood, John Campbell Hortenstine, Henry Bearden Mulholland, Edwin Partridge Lehman, William Henry Parker, William Roland Hill, Charles Bruce Morton, William Edward Bray, Kenneth Boyd Grim, Samuel Alexander Vest, Edgar Wilson Kirby, Bruno Barelare, Tiffany Johns Williams, John McIntire Nokes, William Wirt Waddell, McLemore Birdsong, William Gayle Crutchfield, Everett Cato Drash, Edwin Webster Shearburn, Byrd Stuart Leavell, William Maryon Moir, David Cole Wilson, Thomas Shepherd Englar, Byrd Stuart Leavell, Oscar Swineford, Staige Davis Blackford, John Osborne McNeel, James Alexander Waddell, Dudley Crofford Smith, Fletcher Drummond Woodward, Vincent William Archer, George Cooper, Eugene Markley Landis, George McLean Lawson, Claude C. Coleman, Theodore Hough, William Douglas Macon, William Edward Brown, and Leroy Adelbert Calkins

In our rare book collection there are other items of interest related to the student notebooks. These include the Syllabus of the Lectures on Medical Jurisprudence and on the Treatment of Poisoning & Suspended Animation, Delivered in the University of Virginia, by Robley Dunglison and printed in 1827 as well as volumes related to anatomy by William Beverley Towles. Towles' works are Notes on Anatomy printed in 1886, Anatomy Notes published in 1890, Notes on Anatomy published in 1893, and Descriptive Anatomy published in 1898 and 1904.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The notebooks range from 1836-1943 and include notes taken in classes for anatomy, surgery, physiology, gynecology, midwifery, chemistry, materia medica, preventive medicine, practice of medicine, ENT, bacteriology, jurisprudence, pharmacy, organic chemistry, pathology, psychobiology, internal medicine, toxicology, clinical diagnosis, histology, biology, syphilology, embryology, heart disease, urology, physical diagnosis, dermatology, pediatrics, orthopedics, Roentgenology, edpidemiology, nervous system, case teaching, and insanity.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The first 13 boxes and Box 14 through folder 5 are arranged chronologically. From Box 14, folder 6 the arrangement is in the order received.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Notes on Midwifery 1840-41

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken at the University of Virginia by Alexander M. Campbell from Dr. Howards' lectures, Session of 1840 &41. Included are directions for purifying gold, silver solder, gold solder, stannate, flux, and enamels. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," A. M. Campbell attended UVA in 1840-41.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Lectures of Professors J[ames] L. Cabell, [Henry] Howard, [John S.] Davis and [Socrates] Maupin 1854-55

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by James Sandford, M.D. Accounts related to medical visits are also included. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," James Sandford attended UVA during the 1854-55 session.

did.unittitle: Syllabuses on Chemistry by Dr. J. A. Templeton, M.D. 1854-55

scopecontent.p: According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," James A. Templeton attended UVA during the 1854-55 session.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Surgery 1855-56

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by William Joseph Jones, a resident of Amherst County, Virginia, born in Fluvanna County, Virginia. Jones, has made drawings of Jno. S. Davis, Jas. L. Cabell, Henry Howard, and S[ocrates] Maupin.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Physiology lectures by Dr. J[ames] L. Cabbell [Cabell] 1867 November 14 - 1868 April 16

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by William B. Towles. According to the "Catalogue of the University of Virginia, 1868-69," William Beverly Towles received his MD degree in 1869.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: University of Virginia Materia Medica lectures by Dr. [John Staige] Davis 1868-69

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by A. M. Hill. Hill lists a roll of the medical class at UVa for the 1868-69 session, including Walter Reed. Hill has 44 names written down with an additional 3 who took only one medical course. According to the "Catalogue of the University of Virginia, 1968-69," Augustus Middleton Hill was a student during the 1968-69 session.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Notes on the Practice of Medicine by T. B. Pugh, Session 1873-74, University of Virginia 1873-74

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken at the University of Virginia by T. B. Pugh from Napoleonville, Louisiana, Woodlawn Plantation. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," Thomas Bryan Pugh was a student during the 1973-74 session.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Lectures on Physiology and Surgery by Professor Cabell. 1873 October - 1874 January 15
did.physdesc: ADS notebook bound with copied lecture notes.

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by T. B. Pugh. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," Thomas Bryan Pugh was a student during the 1973-74 session.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Lectures on Materia Medica, Volume I 1873 October 1 - 1874

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by T. B. Pugh. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," Thomas Bryan Pugh was a student during the 1973-74 session.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Chemistry Lectures of Thomas Bryan Pugh 1873 October 3 - 1874
did.physdesc: ADS notebook bound with copied lecture notes.

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by Thomas Bryan Pugh. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," Thomas Bryan Pugh was a student during the 1973-74 session.The professor was [John W.] Mallett.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Lectures on Jurisprudence and Obstetrics by Prof [James F.] Harrison 1873-1874

scopecontent.p: The medical notes were taken by Thomas B. Pugh. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," Thomas Bryan Pugh was a student during the 1973-74 session. The unbound pages contain exercises in English and Greek.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Lectures on Pharmacy 1873-1874

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by T. B. Pugh. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," Thomas Bryan Pugh was a student during the 1973-74 session.

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by T. B. Pugh. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," Thomas Bryan Pugh was a student during the 1973-74 session.

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by O. Nalle. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," Orville Nalle graduated with an MD degree in 1884.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Notes on Surgery and Material Medica, Book No. 2 1884 February 18 - 1884 May 30 and 1885 January 13

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by O. Nalle. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," Orville Nalle graduated with an MD degree in 1884. The surgery lectures were given by Professor [James L.] Cabell. The unbound pages contain information about nerves.

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by W. Levi Old. The name of Albert H. Tuttle, Professor of Biology and Agriculture was also written in the notebook.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Orthopedics 1925 February 6-May 8

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by Daniel O. Nichols from Hinton, West Virginia. The notebook is a gift from Dr. Weaver in Culpeper, Virginia dated April 17, 1975. According to the "University of Virginia Record," Daniel Oscar Nichols graduated with his MD degree June 1926.

did.unittitle: Notebook: Pathology notes 1930 June 24-August 7

scopecontent.p: The notebook has Oscar Swineford written on it and a note that indicates it is his notebook. But if so, this could not be a "student" notebook as Swineford graduated from UVa SOM in 1926. Chiarri is written on the front of the notebook and on pages inside but it is not clear if this is a student or instructor name.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Pathology notes 1930 June 10-August 14

scopecontent.p: The notebook has Oscar Swineford written on it and a note that indicates it is his notebook. But if so, this could not be a "student" notebook as Swineford graduated from UVa SOM in 1926.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Materia Medica notes 1929-30

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by D. F. Weaver. According to the the "University of Virginia Record," Delmar Franklin Weaver graduated with an MD degree on June, 14, 1932.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Pediatrics 1931 September 21-December 5

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by J. A. M. Thompson. According to the the "University of Virginia Record," John A. Moorman Thompson graduated with an MD degree on June, 13, 1933. The lecturer was Dr. [Lawrence T.] Royster. The notebook is a gift of Ms. Roberta Senechal and Mr. James Skalnik.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Syphilology 1932 January 5 - 1933 March 17

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by J. A. M. Thompson. According to the the "University of Virginia Record," John A. Moorman Thompson graduated with an MD degree on June, 13, 1933. The lecturer was Dr. [Lawrence T.] Royster. The notebook is a gift of Ms. Roberta Senechal and Mr. James Skalnik. Also includes notes in public health taught by Dr. Kenneth F. Maxcy.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Calibration of Volumetric Apparatus 1937 August 3-September 28

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by Armistead P. Booker. According to the "University of Virginia Record," Armistead Page Booker graduated with an MD degree on June, 15, 1943. The inscription on the front cover includes "Eastern Laboratory, Gibbstown, N.J." Eastern Laboratory was a research facility developed by DuPont.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Laboratory Notebook in Physiology 1935 November 6
did.physdesc: TDS notebook with A notes, 1 TLS copy

scopecontent.p: The notebook was done by Malcolm Foote Sher and Charlotte Swaney. Sher donated it in 1992. According to the "University of Virginia Record," Malcolm Foote Sher and Charlotte Ellen Swaney both received their MD degrees on June 13, 1938.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Surgery 1936 January - 1937 June

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by Malcolm Foote Sher. ccording to the "University of Virginia Record," Malcolm Foote Sher received his MD degrees on June 13, 1938. The notebook is divided into sections: General Principles by Dr. [Edwin Partridge] Lehman, Abdominal Surgery by Dr. [Edwin Partridge] Lehman, General Surgery by Dr. [Charles Bruce] Morton, Thoracic Surgery by Dr. [Everett Cato] Drash, Sympath. Surgery by Dr. [Edwin Partridge] Lehman, Neuro Surgery by Dr. [Claude C.] Coleman, Urology by Dr. [John Henry] Neff and Gynecology by Dr. [Charles Bruce] Morton.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Medicine, Materia Medica and Chemistry [1836]

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken William H. Harding. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," Harding attended sessions in 1835-36 and 1836-37. According to the accompanying letter from Palinurus Antiquarian Books, the lectures were given by John Patten Emmet. The letter also indicates that Harding was from a Virginia family in Northumberland County whose estate and plantation still stand, that he practiced medicine and served in the Virginia General Assembly before an untimely death. In the back of the notebook are fragments of letters to people including Ann H. George and his uncle.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Physiology and Pharmacology 1922 September 20 - 1923 May 25

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by Porter B. Echols. According to the "Catalogue of the Officers and Students of the University of Virginia," Porter Burks Echols graduated June 1925. The lecturers include Drs. [Theodore] Hough and [James Alexander] Waddell. The notebook was donated by Dr. Porter B. Echols, Jr. in May 2008.

The notebook was donated by Dr. Porter B. Echols, Jr. in May 2008.

The lecturers included Drs. [Lawrence T.] Royster, [Leroy Adelbert] Calkins, and [John Staige] Davis. The notebook was donated by Dr. Porter B. Echols, Jr. in May 2008.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Anatomy 1873 October 4 - 1874 June 22

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by Charles Shepherd Webb. According to his brief autobiography, when he attended the University of Virginia, he took a "thorough course in the theoretical branches and then went to the University of New York to get the benefit of the hospitals." He graduated with the degree of M.D. from the University of New York. The UVa lecturer was John Staige Davis in anatomy. The notebook also contains notes that were given by Professor Darling at the University of New York and another section on materia medica. The notebook was donated by Ann W. McDowell, Webb's granddaughter, in March 2010.

did.unittitle: Student notebook: Notes on Chemistry and Medicine, 1839 September 16 - 1840 March 30

scopecontent.p: The notes were taken by Jethro Meriwether Hurt. Hurt attended the University of Virginia for the 1839-40 session and studied Chemistry, Medicine, and Anatomy and Surgery. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania Medical School in 1841. (September 1839-1840 at the University of Virginia): Notes on chemistry (Dr. [John P.] Emmet) -- Chlorosis, page 23, (Dr. [Henry] Howard, March 1840) -- Muscles -- On the treatment of cholera (Dr. Howard) -- Series on the brain and spinal marrow -- Anatomy -- Cholera asphyscia -- Medicine (Dr. Griffith) -- Of yellow fever -- Congestive fever (December 5, 1839) -- Treatment of gastritis -- Symptoms of chronic enteritis -- Diarrhoea acute and chronic -- Causes of hepatitis -- Symptoms of meningitis -- General cerebritis -- Dr. [James L.] Cabell notes (1839) -- Dr. Howard notes. Gift of Jethro Meriwether Hurt, III. Fragile with brittle pages.

did.unittitle: Student notebook 1840

scopecontent.p: Volume 2 (1840 continued ) -- Howard's lecture on midwifery -- Haemorrage -- Metritis on puerpera fever -- Signs of delivery -- Rape -- Latent diseases -- Survivorship -- Wounds --- Persons found dead -- Adipocere -- Poisons -- Cough mixture [and other remedies and ointments]. Gift of Jethro Meriwether Hurt, III. Fragile with brittle pages and mold damage.

did.unittitle: Student notebook 1841 January 16 - February 20

scopecontent.p: Volume 3 Notes on materia medica (Dr. Emmet) January 16, 1841 - February 9, 1841 at the University of Pennsylvania): Midwifery -- Labor -- Presentations -- Causes -- Treatment -- Mechanism of presentations -- Hodge (January 20, 1841) -- Wood (February 20, 1841) -- Thraxacum -- Mineral acuscles -- Vegetable astringents -- Kino -- Nervous stimulants (Dr. Wood) -- Cerebral stimulants -- Alcohol -- Opium -- Hemorrhage -- Hyoscyamus -- Camphor -- Belladonna -- Dr. Jackson -- Vascular repair -- Dr. Wood -- Arterial sedatives -- Nux vomica -- Ansenic -- Emetics -- Cathartics. Gift of Jethro Meriwether Hurt, III. Fragile with brittle pages.
